metadata.title: CVE-2020-15652 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
By observing the stack trace for JavaScript errors in web workers, it waspossible to leak the result of a cross-origin redirect. This applied onlyto content that can be parsed as script. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 79, Firefox ESR < 68.11, Firefox ESR < 78.1, Thunderbird < 68.11, andThunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
